alert.note: Alert for Walsh (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 25 at 12:01PM CDT until further notice by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM CDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt continues. * WHERE...A portion of northeast North Dakota, including the following county, Walsh. * WHEN...Until 400 PM CDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1154 AM CDT, satellite imagery continues to indicate overland flooding, particularly within eastern Walsh County. Emergency management recently reported overland flooding from snow melt. - Ongoing snowmelt will continue to lead to widespread flooding impacts through at least Friday. This may include road closures, washouts, and other snowmelt related flooding impacts. Precipitation may exacerbate these impacts.
info.instruction: Safety message - Turn around, don`t drown. Don`t travel through flooded areas. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
